meanings.definition: Capable of being dismissed from a job.
meanings.sent1: The lazy employee was sackable due to frequent absences.
meanings.sent2: It is important to show dedication at work to avoid being sackable.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy cat was sackable from its position as the office nap supervisor.
meanings.sent4: Her constant tardiness made her sackable like a wilting flower.
meanings.sent5: The unreliable alarm clock was as sackable as a leaky boat.

meanings.sent1: The dishonest manager was sackable for stealing company funds.
meanings.sent2: Employees who break company rules are sackable for their actions.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy waiter was sackable for turning the restaurant into a comedy show.
meanings.sent4: His repeated mistakes made him as sackable as a burnt toast.
meanings.sent5: The reckless driver was as sackable as a driver with a blindfold on.

meanings.definition: Able to be terminated from employment.
meanings.sent1: The temporary contract workers were sackable at any time.
meanings.sent2: In some companies, even minor errors can make employees sackable.
meanings.sent3: The forgetful secretary was sackable for accidentally deleting important files.
meanings.sent4: The old computer was as sackable as a broken pencil.
meanings.sent5: The unreliable internet connection was as sackable as a wet matchstick.
